Partie de campagne

This bittersweet film from Jean Renoir, based on a story by Guy de
Maupassant, is a tenderly comic idyll about a city familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s picnic
in the French countryside and the romancing of the mother and grown
daughter by two local men. Conceived as a short feature, the project
had nearly finished production in 1936 when Renoir was called away
for The Lower Depths. Shooting was abandoned then, but the film was
completed with the existing footage by RenoirÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s team and released in
its current form in 1946, after the director had already moved on to
Hollywood.
The result is a warmly humanist vignette that ranks among RenoirÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s
most lyrical works, with a love for nature imbuing its every
beautiful frame.
